title: Induced current - wire dropped between magnets

content.question: A square loop of wire is held above two bar magnets with opposite poles facing each other. The loop is dropped between the magnets. Which of the following claims about the induced current is correct?

choices.label: The induced current switches direction when half the loop has passed through the magnets.
The induced current increases in magnitude the entire time the loop is falling.
The maximum induced current occurs when the flux through the loop is at a maximum.
The induced current would be greater if the loop was horizontal rather than vertical when being dropped.

content.answer: The induced current switches direction when half the loop has passed through the magnets.

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
